application.name: kaguyasp2isis
application.brief: Imports a Kaguya SP (Spectral Profiler) file

description.p: This program will import a Kaguya SP (Spectral Profiler) file to a tab delimited text file. The text file will contain one record for each wavelength in the SP file. There are 296 wavelengths available in an SP file. Each record in the output file will contain all the observations for a specific wavelength. The user can limit the number of observations that are listed by using the MINOBS and MAXOBS parameters.

The documents in the kaguyasp2isis/assets directory provide information about the Kaguya Spectral Profiler data. The directory also contains a cheat sheet to determine what the different Quality Assessment values mean.

Please note that there is no attempt by this program to remove redundant or erroneous data at the instrument joins (e.g., VIS, NIR1, NIR2). Also, the data currently available do not extend to the NIR2 wavelengths in calibrated form.

history.change: Original version. This program imports binary data from a Kaguya Spectral Profiler file and puts the data into a tab delimited table.

Changed the line: Utility to Kaguya so that this app does not appear under a list of Core ISIS programs, but instead appears with kaguyami2isis and kaguyac2isis under Mission Specific programs in the documentation.

parameter.name: FROM
parameter.description: This is the input Kaguya SP file

parameter.name: TO
parameter.description: The output file will be formatted as a tab delimited file and will contain all requested observations for a single wavelength in each record of the file. Each observation will include the raw, radiance, reflectance, and QA information.

parameter.name: MINOBS
parameter.description: This is the minimum observation of the observation range for which information will be obtained from the input file. If no value is specified, then the minimum will be set to 1.

parameter.name: MAXOBS
parameter.description: This is the maximum observation of the observation range for which information will be obtained from the input file. If no value is specified, then the maximum will be set to the maximum observation in the input file.
